Title: Bacula: Information disclosure
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in Bacula may allow local attackers to obtain sensitive
    information.

Background.Text: Bacula is a network based backup suite.

Description.Text: Matthijs Kooijman reported that the "make_catalog_backup" script uses the MySQL password as a command line argument when invoking other programs.

Impact.Text: A local attacker could list the processes on the local machine when the script is running to obtain the MySQL password. Note: The password could also be disclosed via network sniffing attacks when the script fails, in which case it would be sent via cleartext e-mail.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
A warning about this issue has been added in version 2.4.1, but the
    issue is still unfixed. We advise not to use the make_catalog_backup
    script, but to put all MySQL parameters into a dedicated file readable
    only by the user running Bacula.
